radiographic_examinations.findings: Abnormal uptake suggestive of malignancy in the base of the heart.
Soft tissue mass on top of the atrioventricular groove encasing the right coronary artery.
Completely normal cardiac and valve function; however, a large right ventricular mass was seen.
No ischemic insult, no cerebral mass, and normal carotid arteries.
Area of increased uptake in the anterior mediastinum with a standardized uptake value of 2.8, within the malignant range but not typical for high-grade sarcoma.
